Material used.Description: HEK293 cells were transfected with plasmids expressing wild-type and mutant SNCA variants.

Readout description.Result Description: Increased alpha-synuclein aggregation in A53T-transfected cells compared to wild-type (p < 0.01).
A30P mutation showed enhanced oligomerization in Western Blot analysis (2.5-fold increase).
E46K variant exhibited reduced solubility and increased insoluble aggregates (p < 0.05).

Biological replicates.Description: Three independent biological replicates were conducted for each variant.

Technical replicates.Description: Each sample was run in triplicate for Western Blot analysis.

Basic positive control.Description: Wild-type SNCA-expressing cells served as the positive control.

Basic negative control.Description: Empty vector-transfected HEK293 cells were used as the negative control.

Statistical analysis method.Statistical analysis method: ANOVA with post-hoc Tukey's test was used for multiple comparisons.

Material used.Description: Immunohistochemistry was performed on brain tissue from transgenic mice expressing SNCA variants.

Readout description.Result Description: A53T-expressing mice showed Lewy body-like inclusions in the substantia nigra (p < 0.001).
A30P mice exhibited increased neuronal loss in the dopaminergic system (25% reduction).
E46K mice showed diffuse alpha-synuclein accumulation in the cortex (p < 0.01).

Biological replicates.Description: Five mice per group were analyzed for each variant.

Technical replicates.Description: No technical replicates were explicitly mentioned.

Basic positive control.Description: Wild-type SNCA-expressing mice served as the positive control.

Basic negative control.Description: Non-transgenic mice were used as the negative control.

Statistical analysis method.Statistical analysis method: Student's t-test was used for comparing mutant vs. wild-type groups.

Threshold for normal readout.Threshold for normal readout: No immunoreactive inclusions in dopaminergic neurons

Threshold for abnormal readout.Threshold for abnormal readout: Presence of Lewy body-like inclusions in > 30% of neurons

Material used.Description: Behavioral tests were conducted on transgenic mice expressing SNCA variants to assess motor function.

Readout description.Result Description: A53T mice showed 40% reduction in rotarod performance compared to controls (p < 0.001).
A30P mice exhibited 35% decrease in open field exploration (p < 0.01).
E46K mice demonstrated 25% reduction in rotarod latency (p < 0.05).

Biological replicates.Description: Ten mice per group were tested for each variant.

Technical replicates.Description: No technical replicates were explicitly mentioned.

Basic positive control.Description: Wild-type SNCA-expressing mice served as the positive control.

Basic negative control.Description: Non-transgenic mice were used as the negative control.

Statistical analysis method.Statistical analysis method: Two-way ANOVA with post-hoc Bonferroni correction was used.

Threshold for normal readout.Threshold for normal readout: Rotarod latency > 120 seconds; open field distance > 5 meters

Threshold for abnormal readout.Threshold for abnormal readout: Rotarod latency < 60 seconds; open field distance < 2 meters
